alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Franklin; Harnett; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:18AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Harnett, northeastern Lee, Wake, southeastern Durham, eastern Chatham and southwestern Franklin Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 817 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Zebulon to near Garner to 8 miles northwest of Lillington. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs and Morrisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chatham; Durham; Franklin; Harnett; Lee; Wake
